content.description: Unknown #1 starts back on a good hand jam and works out to an off-width slither through the narrow opening on crystals and a jam. Since it can be seen from the parking lot, I'm assuming that this has been done. So if anyone knows of FA info, I'll update things. I bet there are many ways to work through this, but figuring things out is half the fun.
content.location: Unknown #1 can be seen from the Box Canyon parking lot. With the gazebo to your back, Unknown #1 is directly in front of you on the lower part of the slab, about 100-150 yards on the other side of the aspens. The crack runs perpendicular and to the right when looking from the parking lot.

content.description: This is a short roof. Sit starting on fingerlock, pull up, and mantel over the roof. This is very silly if you are tall.
content.protection: It's 3 feet off climbing. Bring a pad if you want.
content.location: This is on the right side of the Box Canyon Trail if you park near the gazebo. It is just after the huge boulder and pretty obvious.

content.description: This is just opposite the tiny fingercrack roof. Sit start on good holds, and stand up.
content.protection: A pad and tarp (it can be very swampy at the base).
content.location: If you are standing at the tiny fingercrack roof and facing it, turn 180 degrees and walk to the boulder you will be facing.

content.description: Prizefighter starts standing on good holds on the arete, make a few moves up the arete on good holds to a long move to a crimp and a commiting mantle on small crystals.  Downclimb the tree to get off the boulder.  Very fun!!
content.protection: Pads. Spotter would be nice for the mantle, but not neccessary.  Be careful not to tip the boulder over....
content.location: Take the trail up Box Canyon to where it Ys, take the right trail for maybe twenty feet, and you'll see the huge balanced boulder that is not held up by anything but the rock it sits on.  Right by the picnic area with an amazing arete.

content.description:
The route was named after the mantle move and turtle looking boulder.

Start low on a small flake, bump left for a sidepull, and shoot up for for a mantle.
content.protection: Pad and spotter due to proximity to another boulder.
content.location:
Facing Walt's Wall, this is up and left from

Get On the Good Foot

.

content.description: Start with both hands in a small indent. The interesting part comes once your hands are on the roof and have thrown a high right foot.
content.protection: Spotter and a pad would be a nice to have.
content.location: Facing towards Coke Bottle and right of a Gazebo - it is right of a make-shift fire pit.

content.description:
This route is the direct start to

Cracked Sky

.  Starts sitting on the arete with a left sidepull/crimp and a right sloper.  Figure out the feet and bump right to a bad sloper and go straight up the arete finishing with the end of

Cracked Sky

.
content.location:
Cracked Sky

cave (see

Cracked Sky

for directions).

content.description: Start on a crimp, throw a high right foot, and shoot up for a right thumb hold. Having a solid right foot and finding balance will be the keys.
content.location: It is right behind a bench in the BCT parking lot.

content.description: Starts sitting with two small crimps in the middle of the bloc, traverse up and right on sharp crimps to the arete and mantle around the arete.  Probably much harder for the shorter folk.  Another classic Davin Bagdonas route!!!
content.location: As you walk into Box Canyon, there is a very large boulder on the right side of the trail before it splits.  The cracked cave is straight above it on the hillside about halfway up, along with other quality Bagdonas problems like 'Power and the Glory' and 'Rosebud Strong'.

content.description: Not bad for a one move V7.  Start matched on two really high crimps, pull your feet up onto the wall and throw for the lip.  If there were more moves, this would get more stars, but for one move, it's pretty fun.
content.location: Take the Box Canyon trail to where it Ys, take the left trail for about 30 feet or so, and you'll see the boulder off to the left.
